Very inspiring talk from @Sir_David_King, gives me hope that he's head of UK diplomatic group for #COP21 #camclimate
Irrespective of climate change, there will be immense benefits to human health and most economies @Sir_David_King #camclimate
My plea to IPCC 6th report authors is to consider correlated risks, which could lead to larger systematic risk @Sir_David_King #camclimate
I believe we will get an agreement. Assistance for poorer countries and a feeling of fairness will be key issues @Sir_David_King #camclimate
COP is important, but not the only game in town. However, no agreement would be very dispiriting. It should be a stepping stone. #camclimate
Target: new-build renewables cheaper than new-build coal. Energy storage solutions needed. #camclimate
However, we need more support for innovation, eg 'Global Apollo Program' @Sir_David_King #camclimate
UK low carbon economy has 2x turnover of auto industry, same gross value food & drink. Energy industry huge = huge opportunities #camclimate
Within 15 yrs, UK gov has committed to get electricity to all African villages via renewables. Cheaper than getting on the grid! #camclimate
With 1m sea level rise, 100 yr sea level events will occur 800+ times per 100yrs in Kolkata #camclimate
A 4°C world isn't that far away in probabilities... 7°C a possibility #camclimate
Risk of fatal heat stress in India, SE China and SE USA spikes beyond 4°C #camclimate
Based on 1% risk over 10 years, UK government decided to vaccinate against Avian Flu at considerable cost #camclimate
Plans put in place on recommendation of @Sir_David_King saved £billions during 2013/14 UK floods, based on modelling studies #camclimate
Final speaker today is past Chief Scientific Advisor @Sir_David_King  #camclimate
Why has COP not had as much success as Montreal? It was an easier problem, but the required protocol wasn't arrived at quickly #camclimate
End of century projections of ozone limited by uncertainty in methane and NO2 emissions #camclimate
Montreal Protocol climate saving has been greater than the Kyoto Agreement, but that could reverse... #camclimate
Within a century of its recognition, ozone layer depletion will be reversed. However, some CFC replacements are greenhouse gases #camclimate
Key principles of Montreal P: Commitment, monitoring, compliance, consensus & assistance (for developing countries) #camclimate
And now, Prof John Pyle on "Why the Montreal Protocol works"  #camclimate
Less than 1/2 the cost to sell solar cell, battery and LED offgrid than to burn kerosene, no subsidies needed! See @azuri_tech #camclimate
Current best solar cell 28% efficient, not great, Prof Friend working on 'buy one get one free' magic solar paint to add on top. #camclimate
Best payback time for solar panels is around 1.5 years. Nature manages a few days for a green leaf. Solar is only just starting. #camclimate
"Solar is the future" Prof Friend #camclimate
But, have to take into account that demand might go up as price comes down... #camclimate
Tungsten light bulbs only 10% efficient  LEDs close to 100%, lighting currently 30% of electricity use. #camclimate
But our current smartphones 1 million times worse than theoretical limit at energy efficiency, future iPhone unimaginable #camclimate
For example, we are close to the limit of theoretically achievable aircraft efficiency (with hydrocarbon fuel) #camclimate
Technology to the rescue? Are we doing as well as we can (wout violating the laws of thdynamics) or are we just getting started? #camclimate
Currently, wellbeing is strongly correlated with energy use #camclimate
Prof Friend is head of Winton Programme for Physics of Sustainability #camclimate
Next up, Richard Friend on "Energy: Lessons from Nature" #camclimate
Key area of uncertainty is regional impacts on societies and ecosystems, but not a straightforward problem @emilyshuckburgh #camclimate
A 2 degree pathway requires 42 Gt CO2 emitted at 2030. All conditional and unconditional #COP21 pledged leave us 12 Gt short... #camclimate
Limit of 1000Gt of carbon to stay below 2°C implies delayed action will require steeper reductions. #COP21 #camclimate
Current Paris pledges estimated to deliver +2.7°C at the end of the century #camclimate
There are always winners and losers, when you talk about risk it matters Who, Where, and When @emilyshuckburgh  #camclimate
Consequences of +4°C more than twice those of + 2°C - nonlinearities and thresholds #camclimate
Uncertainty in climate feedbacks leads to uncertainty in future projections,  eg clouds, aerosols, permafrost, cryosphere... #camclimate
Risk of v hot summer in Europe now 1 in 5 yrs. Natural level = less than 1 in 1000 yrs. Extremes altered by shifts in pdf. #camclimate
UK floods 2014: for the same weather pattern, extreme rainfall in 10 days now 7x more likely today under #climatechange #camclimate
Average surface temperature can be a useful metric -  many changes linearly related to it @emilyshuckburgh #camclimate
Our longest spanning ice core goes back 800kyr, modern humans emerged ~200kyr ago #camclimate
